intro: Diphyes loxophylla, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a shrub native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many evergreen and deciduous shrubs. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in forested areas. Its leaves are small, leathery, and often have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer.
